dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: People think the biggest movie stars just get huge upfront paychecks, but actually, the real money is in those back-end profit deals.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: People think the biggest movie stars just get huge upfront paychecks, but actually, the real money is in those back-end profit deals.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While the lucrative twenty-twenty deal ($20 million upfront and 20% of gross profit) doled out to the likes of Harrison Ford and Tom Cruise may be more or less gone, Hollywood still has its big-money brands, those actors who can promise an audience so big that they command not only an eight-figure salary to show up on set but also a decent chunk of a films nebulous poolor the money left over after some but not all of the bills are paid.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely. I mean, Robert Downey Jr. topped the list with over a hundred and five million dollars, and a big chunk of that came from his twenty-twenty deal for Avengers: Endgame.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. I mean, Robert Downey Jr. topped the list with over a hundred and five million dollars, and a big chunk of that came from his twenty-twenty deal for Avengers: Endgame.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Robert Downey Jr. gets $20 million upfront and nearly 8% of the pool for his role as Iron Man, and that amounted to about $55 million for his work in Avengers: Endgame, which grossed $2.796 billion at the box office. 3. Robert Downey Jr. Earnings: $66 million

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and he also got fifteen percent of the pool from Thor: Ragnarok, which made like, what, eight hundred fifty million?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and he also got fifteen percent of the pool from Thor: Ragnarok, which made like, what, eight hundred fifty million?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He also commands up to 15% of the pool from high-grossing franchise movies, including Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle, which had a worldwide box office of $962.1 million.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, eight hundred fifty point two million. And then he's got that sitcom, The Iron Man Show, bringing in six hundred fifty thousand per episode.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, eight hundred fifty point two million. And then he's got that sitcom, The Iron Man Show, bringing in six hundred fifty thousand per episode.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And he is paid $700,000 per episode for HBOs Ballers and seven figures in royalties for his line of clothing, shoes and headphones with Under Armour.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But it's not just him—Bradley Cooper, uh, earned fifty-seven million total, but only twenty percent was from Guardians of the Galaxy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it's not just him-Bradley Cooper, uh, earned fifty-seven million total, but only twenty percent was from Guardians of the Galaxy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The actor earned only about 10% of his $57 million payday for voicing Rocket Raccoon in Avengers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the rest was from A Star Is Born, which he directed and starred in. That film had a fifty-six million budget but made six hundred fifty million worldwide.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the rest was from A Star Is Born, which he directed and starred in. That film had a fifty-six million budget but made six hundred fifty million worldwide.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It paid offthe movie, which had a production budget of only $36 million, grossed $435 million worldwide, leaving Cooper with an estimated $40 million.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And he waived his upfront payment for that, so his backend must've been massive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And he waived his upfront payment for that, so his backend must've been massive.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The movie was a passion project for Cooper, and he forfeited any upfront salary to go into the film and Gagas salary.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And then you've got Dwayne Johnson at number one with eighty-nine point four million, even though his Marvel deals aren't as high as Downey's.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And then you've got Dwayne Johnson at number one with eighty-nine point four million, even though his Marvel deals aren't as high as Downey's.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's interesting though—Chris Hemsworth was second with seventy-six million, and he even wore a ten-pound muscle suit for Thanos, but his pay structure's not quite the same.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's interesting though-Chris Hemsworth was second with seventy-six million, and he even wore a ten-pound muscle suit for Thanos, but his pay structure's not quite the same.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Chris Hemsworth Wore a 70-Pound Fat Suit to Play Thor in Avengers A bankable leading man is still one of Hollywoods surest bets, even if your name isnt Leonardo DiCaprio.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the rankings really show how diverse these income streams are. Even Paul Rudd and Will Smith are up there with forty-one and thirty-five million.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the rankings really show how diverse these income streams are. Even Paul Rudd and Will Smith are up there with forty-one and thirty-five million.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 10. Will Smith Earnings: $35 million 9. Paul Rudd Earnings: $41 million

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And all these figures are pretax, before agents and managers take their cuts, which can be another like, what, thirty percent?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And all these figures are pretax, before agents and managers take their cuts, which can be another like, what, thirty percent?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: All figures are pretax; fees for agents, managers and lawyers (generally 10%, 15% and 5%, respectively) are not deducted.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh, around that. It's a whole ecosystem.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh-huh, around that. It's a whole ecosystem.

artist_script:
HostA: People think the biggest movie stars just get huge upfront paychecks, but actually, the real money is in those back-end profit deals.
HostB: Oh, absolutely. I mean, Robert Downey Jr. topped the list with over a hundred and five million dollars, and a big chunk of that came from his twenty-twenty deal for Avengers: Endgame.
HostA: Right, and he also got fifteen percent of the pool from Thor: Ragnarok, which made like, what, eight hundred fifty million?
HostB: Yeah, eight hundred fifty point two million. And then he’s got that sitcom, The Iron Man Show, bringing in six hundred fifty thousand per episode.
HostA: But it’s not just him—Bradley Cooper, uh, earned fifty-seven million total, but only twenty percent was from Guardians of the Galaxy.
HostB: Yeah, the rest was from A Star Is Born, which he directed and starred in. That film had a fifty-six million budget but made six hundred fifty million worldwide.
HostA: And he waived his upfront payment for that, so his backend must’ve been massive.
HostB: Exactly. And then you’ve got Dwayne Johnson at number one with eighty-nine point four million, even though his Marvel deals aren’t as high as Downey’s.
HostA: It’s interesting though—Chris Hemsworth was second with seventy-six million, and he even wore a ten-pound muscle suit for Thanos, but his pay structure’s not quite the same.
HostB: Yeah, the rankings really show how diverse these income streams are. Even Paul Rudd and Will Smith are up there with forty-one and thirty-five million.
HostA: And all these figures are pretax, before agents and managers take their cuts, which can be another like, what, thirty percent?
HostB: Uh-huh, around that. It’s a whole ecosystem.
